history.content:
Hello, 


The faculty have not yet approved any such exception for the minor. You could email me a request for an exception, but it would need to cover all material taught in EE 16A/B (including controls and SVD). Otherwise, look into EECS 47D in place of EE 16a, with Professor Alon's approval

children.subject: Thanks for the response! Will I still be able to enroll in and receive credit for 16A/B despite having taken Math 54 and 110?
Same answer as before. I'm doubtful that we're going to waive 25% of the requirements for anyone, but the faculty may have an alternative suggestion.
Another student here. Is it possible to waive out of EE 16A/B if I have already taken Math 54, Math 110, EE 127, EE 126, CS 189, and EE 221A (control theory)?

history.content: Hello, I'm currently a senior finishing up my program in Applied Math. I was looking through the EECS/CS courses catalog, and it looks like I'm much more interested in EECS classes than I am in CS classes (the only CS class I want to take is 189). I'd like to pursue a minor in EECS due to this, but it looks like the only thing in the way is the 16A/16B requirement. I've taken Math 54/110 for linear algebra, and will be taking EECS 127 and Stat 153 for optimization/prediction "maturity." I think I have decent enough mathematical maturity that I don't have to take EE 16A/B (enrollment in these classes would also be very difficult as a senior). Is there any way I can replace the EE 16A/B requirement with other upper divisions, or waive out of it? Thank you!
history.subject: Possible to waive out of EE 16A/B for EECS minor?
